orangelight.title: Move viewer location up the page on item level catalog records.

comments.body: One thing we like about the Stanford view is that it doesn't take 100% of the width of the page.  This means that if a user's mouse is one the side of the viewer, they can still scroll down the page.

@sandbergja I think that's a good point — it's frustrating when you're trying to scroll and you wind up zooming in the viewer instead. I think putting the viewer in the Available Online section, and making it as wide as the column, would do that.

The other thought I had, which would be a bigger change, would be making the left column wider and putting the viewer where we put the thumbnail now. We would probably want a button to make the viewer larger, like Youtube and lots of other video sites have these days.

@sandbergja That was an actual painpoint given to us by folks in Mendel Music library, as well as one other user.  They noted frustration trying to scroll back up to the top of the page using their mouse or trackpad, only to be stuck zooming in and out of the viewer.  That is a great point.
Is this old issue related to this feature request: 1757? Linking so we can potentially close/complete it as part of this ticket work.

I don't think  is directly related to this specific issue, but it is indirectly related to discovery of online content and there seems to be an issue with that record in general. Ill comment on the 1757 ticket. thank you!

orangelight.title: Clicking the ark under "Available online" doesn't get me to viewer

comments.body:
### Update
A couple of things here:
1. There are two hyperlinks under "Available online" that navigate to the page one is already on, but slightly lower down the page so you can see a bit of the viewer peeking up to say "hi".  We should probably look into why there are two links to the same content and remove one of those links.
2. Clicking on the links does not navigate one to the viewer, front and center. 

### Expected behaviour
When I click on a link below "available online", I expect that link to either take me to the viewer or navigate to where the viewer is on the page, making it the focal point of the screen.

### Actual behaviour
When I click on a link below "available online", the link navigates to the same page, and only partially brings the viewer into the screen view at the bottom of the page.

### Steps to reproduce behaviour
Go to: https://catalog.princeton.edu/catalog/10656589
Click on either 

### Screenshots
View before clicking on a  "available online" hyperlink:
![Screen Shot 2022-04-22 at 5 40 18 PM (2)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45043014/164800270-862ea7a7-98de-4436-9af4-93ca34549567.png)

View after clicking on a "available online" hyperlink:
![Screen Shot 2022-04-22 at 5 40 27 PM (2)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45043014/164800390-09080c16-ef56-44f7-872d-1cb9ec87abe8.png)

comments.body:
More Plan.

- If it's a DAO that's not a figgy link, render it as a button on the page.
- If it's a DAO that is a figgy link, stash the url and label on the page
- query graphql to get the embed info
- if we stashed a label, replace the text of the link we got back with the label we stashed on the page
- render what we got back from figgy, modified or not



or
- If there's no DAO
- query graphql and get a link (it's a private resource, I'm logged in)
- Insert the link
